column4: description
column5: defeatedDescription

column4: For one horrible moment you stand transfixed by the alien gaze of the disembodied eye before it lashes out with azure fire.
column5: The gelatinous abomination falls to the ground, bursting with a disgusting sploosh.

column4: The sword-like arms of this misshapen creature strike out at you in a blur of ferocity and blue flame.
column5: The misshapen raider lies dead at your feet, filling you with dread even after death.

column4: Bile and shadow drips from the fangs of the alien horror.
column5: Defeated, this mockery of the natural world will cause no more havoc.

column4: A brain with arms and legs moves impossibly across the room. This abomination cannot be left alive.
column5: With a sickening squish, you destroy the aberrant creature. Still not entirely sure how something like that can exist, you hope never to see another.

column4: Each wound seems to make the creature larger and more fearsome.
column5: Even after death, the abomination has a bloodthirsty look in its eyes.

column4: The creature's armor is torn away as each blow received makes it grow bigger and stronger.
column5: The massive abomination defeated, it finally begins to shrink down from its overgrown state.

column4: The abomination's flesh warps and shifts like water with each spell cast.
column5: Slicing into the monster's flesh, you hear the screams of souls trapped within. With one final strike, you drop the seer, stopping its reign of unholy terror.

column4: The world wavers briefly before the mindwarp vanishes from everyone in your party except yourself.
column5: As the mindwarp breaths its final breath, the world shimmers and then returns to normal, the spell broken.

column4: The abomination's single, steely eye stares at you, abyssal energy crackling around it.
column5: You pull your weapon from the plaguegazer's single eye, wiping the abomination's ocular jelly from the blade.

column4: Veins bulge around the abomination's massive, gelatinous, single eye. It seems transfixed on you, never a good sign.
column5: You step away from the fallen brute, doing your best to forget what you saw here today.

column4: At nearly 500 pounds, this beast would be intimidating even if it weren't growling and baring its teeth.
column5: Red flows across the beast's torn, white fur as it staggers away, determined to live another day.

column4: The cold has only served to make this troll angrier and hungrier...
column5: Flames devour the blue-skinned creature, preventing any chance of regeneration.

column4: Towering above you, enormous battleaxe on its shoulder, the frost giant barely acknowledges your existence.
column5: The earth shakes as the frost giant comes crashing down, it's battleaxe stuck in the ground like a massive monument to war.

column4: You're not sure you can outlast the construct's constant clubbing attacks.
column5: The construct defeated, you close your eyes and let unconsciousness take you.

column4: Trained in martial disciplines and shaped by the cold, this creature is probably better avoided than confronted.
column5: You do your best to hide from the creature. Luckily, it seems more interested in whatever it's doing than sniffing out fresh meat.

column4: Before you can be sure what's happening, you find yourself swarmed by an icy group of pointy-nosed assassins.
column5: Cleaving into goblin after goblin, you wonder where they all keep coming from. The battle seems to last for hours and judging by the pile of bodies, it's not entirely impossible...

column4: Icicles hang from the arrow and nose of your blue-skinned assailant.
column5: Icy arrows fly past, narrowly missing but getting closer with each shot. Moving quickly, you're able to take out the goblin before it's able to line you up perfectly.

column4: No mere winter wolf, this creature is covered in icy spikes.
column5: The deadly beast snaps and howls, doing its best to bring you down. Unfortunately for the rime hound, you will be no one's dinner tonight.

column4: Well-trained and hardened by the elements, the warband begins to chant and clang swords against shields, signaling a coming battle.
column5: It seems like two goblins appear for each one you bring down, but eventually you are able to stop the tide of blue-skinned attackers.

column4: The frozen beast stands atop a boulder and howls to signal its brethren that feeding time is near.
column5: The lesser rime hounds quickly scatter as soon as you are able to bring down the alpha. You smile, knowing you probably didn't have enough left within, should the others have decided to attack.

column4: The rock wall seems to come alive before your eyes.
column5: The lesser earth elemental falls over, becoming nothing more than a pile of rocks.

column4: The burning pyre before you shifts and moves, striding towards you with the form of a man.
column5: The elemental defeated, the fire flickers and burns out.

column4: The ground trembles and shakes before rising up and stacking into a humanoid form.
column5: The rocks fall back to the ground, almost as quickly as they had stacked.

column4: The shimmer of heat precedes the creature of pure fire, which moves to block your path.
column5: You can still feel the heat left behind by the defeated elemental.

column4: As if detecting your presence, a rune glows and dissipates, leaving in its wake a man-shaped construct of rock.
column5: You step away from the defeated elemental, looking around unsuccessfully for the person that set the trap to begin with.

column4: A soft hum is heard, followed by the roar of fire. Your advance appears to have summoned a new foe.
column5: "Enough!" screams a wizard, waving his hands to un-summon the elemental. "Very impressive. You have been deemed... worthy."

column4: As you approach, a misshapen formation of rock and clay advances wildly in your direction.
column5: "Like fighting living mud," you think to yourself as you manage to find a way to defeat the unbound elemental.

column4: You have only moments to react as a formless being of fire flares and surges toward you.
column5: The elemental roars and crackles as the fires flame up and then suddenly die out. You're not entirely sure what just happened.

column4: The deep rumbling sound from above is the only warning you have before an earthen creature attacks.
column5: You narrowly avoid being crushed by the creature. Quickly regaining your composure, you stand fast and eventually defeat the earth elemental.

column4: An inhuman roar is heard, followed by a bright orange light. Something has angered a fiery elemental, and you're in its path.
column5: The elemental doesn't seem interested in you. Doing your best not to anger it any further, you hide and wait for it to be gone.

column4: A pale warrior steps from the shadows.
column5: You peer into the darkness knowing this now-fallen soldier will not be the only shadar-kai in the area.

column4: As you move in to attack, this towering warrior melds into the shadows and prepares to strike from the darkness.
column5: Attacks seem to come out of nowhere, frightening and disorienting you. Waiting for your opening, you mortally wound the gloomblade, sending the massive warrior crashing to the ground.

column4: A tattooed witch raises her staff and chants, channeling steadily in your direction.
column5: You charge the witch, determined not to let her complete her spell. You strike as she is about to speak the final words, cutting through the staff and into the witch, killing her.

column4: You come across a floating suit of armor. Before you get a chance to investigate more thoroughly, it raises its blades and attacks!
column5: You step away from the defeated direhelm, not sure what twisted magic could make such a creature.

column4: This armored specter is shrouded in mist and wields a sword wreathed by shadow.
column5: Defeated, the mist and shadow fades away, leaving behind nothing more than some black armor and a twisted blade.

column4: A robed figure blocks your path with a menacing gaze. "Another soul for the taking."
column5: You step over the defeated slaver, your soul perfectly intact.

column4: You find yourself surrounded by armed foes with intricate tattoos and prominent piercings.
column5: "Not... possible..." gasps the last shadar-kai as it falls over dead.

column4: Two pale foes approach with weapons at the ready. "No lost souls left... I suppose we'll have to make another."
column5: Your soul intact, you step between the bodies of the dead hunters and look for your next target.

column4: A wizened, pale fellow approaches, but his smile turns into a menacing sneer. "Let me show you the power Netheril commands!"
column5: "Karsus will see me ... avenged..." the ambassador mutters as the light fades from his eyes.

column4: A look of desperation crosses her face before she lashes out with her blades.
column5: You defeat the exile, putting her out of her misery once and for all.

column4: Possessed of unnatural intelligence, this undead creature could pass as a living being if you squint... and hold your nose.
column5: You defeat the wight before it can drain any of your life energy.

column4: Possessed of unnatural intelligence, this undead creature could pass as a living being if you squint... and hold your nose.
column5: You defeat the undead creature, sending sparking bone tumbling to the ground.

column4: Opening a sarcophagus reveals an intact skeleton. Unfortunately, it ignites and rises from its grave, fixing its eyeless gaze on you.
column5: Battling back against the fire, you are able to dispatch the skeleton with a minimal amount of singed clothing.

column4: This skeleton is wreathed in an unnatural fire, blue in color, which appears to flow in baffling, mind-twisting ways.
column5: Even for the undead, this was an unholy and unnatural thing.

column4: As you enter the room, a fiery skeleton ambles in from another exit. While lacking in purpose, it's still hostile to you.
column5: Only a second death is enough to douse the skeleton's flames, and you are happy to oblige.

column4: The flame around this skeleton sputters and crackles, the bones beneath showing wear and age.
column5: With a heavy CRACK, you splinter the ancient bone, shooting sparks into the air as the skeleton crumbles before you.

column4: The rot is beginning to show on this wight. Its movements are shaky and slow, but that doesn't stop it from charging at you.
column5: Standing over the fallen wight, you whisper a quiet, "Thank you," to whoever had done the initial damage.

column4: A humanoid undead calls out to you with a raspy voice, challenging you to a duel.
column5: You relax your grip, allowing your weapon to fall to the ground next to the defeated battle wight.

column4: You hear a soft sound behind you. You turn around, only to come face to face with a large, undead brute!
column5: Without ever saying a word, the wight's relentless assault finally ends when you separate its head from its body.

column4: You cross paths with a patrolling wight. It's not much of a surprise when he unsheathes his blade.
column5: The wight attempts to signal for reinforcements, but is unable to get the call out before falling at your feet.

column4: Because the sharply bladed discs weren't deadly enough, they've now been edged with poison.
column5: Carefully, you disarm the trap, making sure none of the poison touched your skin.

column4: A single nick from a poisoned arrow can be enough to fell even the mightiest hero.
column5: You disable the trap and inspect the poison arrows. Black adder venom. Deadly.

column4: It will take quick reflexes and a keen eye to avoid this trap.
column5: The darts were coated with drow poison. Not necessarily deadly, but you would have been unconscious for a long time.

column4: If the impalement doesn't kill you, the poison surely will.
column5: Examining the disabled trap, you find the spear to be coated with greenblood oil. Good thing you weren't hit.

column4: You'd never know there was danger nearby were it not for the dried blood on the stones at your feet.
column5: The rockfall trap was expertly hidden. Luckily the previous victim proved to be enough to save your life.

column4: The odds of surviving a fall into this trap have been reduced dramatically...
column5: You're not sure what poison was used to coat the spikes, but you see each shaft crawling with small centipedes.

column4: You hear a click and then a faint hiss before a sickly-sweet odor wafts into the room.
column5: Ungol dust! You cover your nose and mouth and run quickly from the room.

column4: This trap won't kill you quickly, but instead leave you in agonizing pain for a while before you finally succumb to your injuries.
column5: You don't see a good way to disable the trap, so instead you do your best to clearly identify the trigger for future adventurers.

column4: Without knowing why, you feel every last ounce of courage drain from your body.
column5: You manage to find and scratch out the triggered symbol before becoming completely overwhelmed with terror.

column4: So if you pull the southern line while exactly 2 stones are placed on the circular pressure plate... and you angle your body slightly to the left... wait, that won't work...
column5: You study the trap for hours, determined to solve it. Just as you're about to give up, you realize all you have to do is cut the green thread to disable the device.

column4: Your eyes get wide when you realize how valuable this large pile of coins might be.
column5: You fill your pockets with loot, overjoyed at your discovery.

column4: A sizable chest, most likely containing something of great value.
column5: You hold your breath as the lid creaks open. You are almost blinded by the riches contained within.

column4: A wealth of gems could be waiting in a bag this size.
column5: Opening the bag, you can't help but smile as you remove one of the largest gems you've ever seen.

column4: The lockbox is impressive both in size and quality; the box itself might be worth nearly as much as the contents.
column5: Surprisingly, the box contains only a few coins. Looks like the container itself is the real prize after all.

column4: This satchel is large enough to carry dozens of scrolls.
column5: You find a variety of powerful spell scrolls and maps of hidden dungeons.

column4: A soft white glow radiates from the carved box. From a distance you can feel the power of the items within.
column5: Holding the box is enough to feel completely rejuvenated and you feel no need to reveal the contents.

column4: The large treasure chest seems to fade between realities whenever someone gets too close.
column5: You try different tactics for hours, getting nowhere but not getting discouraged. A spirit appears and smiles, "You've been very patient and that should be rewarded." With that, the chest opens and valuable riches float into your hands.

column4: You drop to your knees, mouth agape. This is what you've been searching for.
column5: You take a minute to lay back on the pile of riches. It's every bit as comfortable as you'd imagined it would be.

column4: A simple marker floating in the muck is the only indication something special hides below the surface.
column5: You pull up the sunken treasure, its hidden riches now yours for the taking.

column4: Your stubbed toe is the only reason you know the chest is here. You, in fact, stumbled upon it.
column5: You feel around for a latch but find nothing. Out of frustration, you slam the chest against the wall. It bursts open and the riches inside spill out onto the floor.

column4: A complex series of levers all connect to a single, glowing archway in the middle of the room.
column5: Once correctly aligned, the levers glow and shake causing the archway to emit a strange glow. You think you could step through to a new place.

column4: Someone would rather see you die than make use of that passage.
column5: The guards defeated, you open the trap door and follow where the dark passage leads.

column4: Each time the crystal comes to life, you see a shadow of a distant place.
column5: Touching the crystal the next time it springs to life, you find yourself transported to the distance place.

column4: Disguised as a garbage chute, something tells you this passage actually leads to somewhere special.
column5: Sliding down the magical chute, you find yourself transported to a far away location.

column4: A hooded man points to the ancient portal and whispers, "Know your destination or know your end."
column5: You concentrate on a place you've never seen except on a map. In a blink, you find yourself there!

column4: Some poorly-dressed but well-armed mercenaries block an iron gate.
column5: "Forget it... we ain't paid to do any actual killin'..." one mutters as you prepare for combat. And without another word, the mercenaries wander away.

column4: Clearly, you are meant to find another way through to your destination...
column5: Deciding to take the direct route, you quickly dispatch the guards and make your way over the barricade.

column4: An outline of a door can be made out between a massive number of runes carved into the stone wall.
column5: You trace the outline with your finger and speak the words etched along the edges. The frame glows and a hidden door is revealed.

column4: You wonder what's worth more, the door itself or whatever is on the other side.
column5: Careful not to damage the exquisite workmanship, you pick the lock and gingerly slide the door open.

column4: You are jolted back a few feet after stepping into a heretofore unseen wall of energy.
column5: It takes several attempts before you are able to find the correct spell to remove the barrier, but in the end you are able to move forward.

column4: What evils lurk beneath the surface of the murky black lagoon?
column5: Using a long stick, you poke at the black water. A tentacle grabs the stick and pulls it below the surface, telling you to stay out of the lake...

column4: Each rune seems to speak its own name with a hellish growl.
column5: You perform an extended cleansing ritual, causing the runes to melt from the material plane.

column4: If you can keep everything in proper balance, you might be able to remove the idol undetected...
column5: You balance a bag of dirt in one hand, trying to guess the idol's weight. With a quick switch, you swap the idol for the bag. Looks like you didn't trigger anything...

column4: You don't notice it right away, but your shadow seems intent on doing its own thing, regardless of your actions.
column5: Your shadow leaps and plays, independent of your actions. Eventually it gets bored and reattaches itself to your feet.

column4: What looked like dancing lights in the water at first, now seem to be something else entirely.
column5: You get a closer look and discover some kind of multi-eyed, squid-like creature. Backing away slowly, you retreat from the submerged horror.

column4: Lifting your head off the table, you're barely able to make out a fresh keg of ale being carried by a grinning, thirsty dwarf before you pass back out.
column5: At this point you aren't even sure if you're lifting the mug or if someone else is doing it for you. Regardless, you seem to continue your winning streak...

column4: The group of wizards seem more intent on completing their spell than dealing with any threat you might bring.
column5: You listen to their chants and determine they are attempting to raise the undead. Acting quickly, you stop them before they can complete the ritual.

column4: You hear a faint skittering as thousands of tiny black shadows move across a massive, onyx spider statue.
column5: You kick over the shrine, sending the spiders scurrying across the ground. Lolth will not be pleased...

column4: Scratch. Scratch. Scratch. "Help..." Scratch. Scratch. Scratch.
column5: Listening closely at the wall, you hear nothing further. Whatever was trapped behind the stone has gone silent.

column4: You find the remains of a battle where neither side could truly be called victorious.
column5: You pick through the corpses, checking banners and sigils. Looks like rival shadar-kai factions decided to go to war.

column4: The current champion paints its face with the latest victim's blood before howling at you.
column5: Placing one foot on the chest of the former champion, you raise your hands victoriously.

column4: Unidentifiable monsters slither across one another at the bottom of a large, black hole in the ground.
column5: You toss vials of acid and lit oil pots into the hole, hoping to purge whatever evil was crawling around down there.

column4: Lanterns flicker off and on as if sending some kind of coded message.
column5: You attempt to respond to the code using your own light. The lanterns flash simultaneously and then vanish, a secret passage opening where they once stood.

column4: You see a painting of your future-self standing victorious over a field of slain enemies.
column5: Staring at the painting, you see the image shift to a different outcome, suggesting this is only one of several possible futures.

column4: You don't see an easy place to cross...
column5: You struggle against the current, losing a few supplies and a loosely-held weapon. Still, you manage to cross to the other side relatively unscathed.

column4: You are surrounded by glimmers of what your life would have been if a few flips of fate's coin had been tails instead of heads.
column5: The light fades from the room. As soon as you can see again you search for the magical rip but it seems to have vanished.

column4: Flowing from an unseen source, the water is cool and refreshing.
column5: Taking sips of crisp, clean water, you feel refreshed and ready to complete your adventure.

column4: You find a campsite built for six travelers and a series of plans for defending a far-away city.
column5: Not recognizing the city, you decide to leave the campsite and plans undisturbed.

column4: Their arguments stated, the Angel and Demon both turn to you and ask "Mortal, what is your opinion?"
column5: Though the demon makes a compelling argument, you know better than to side with something from that hellish plane.

column4: "Sit down next to me and I will tell you your future. For a price, of course..."
column5: The prophet speaks of glory and riches, promising that anything is possible with proper determination.

column4: Pieces of the massive contraption are scattered across the floor. Perhaps it could be reassembled?
column5: You reassemble the construct and it stands waiting for a command scroll to be placed in its mouth. Sadly, you do not have one.

column4: The ancient construct stands frozen, waiting for its master to bring it back to life.
column5: Though ancient, the construct still seems to be perfectly put-together. Try as you might, you cannot find a way to reactivate it.

column4: "I am the rightful ruler of this land! Serve me and you will be richly rewarded!"
column5: "Excellent! Excellent! For your loyalty you shall have my greatest treasure!", the mad king yells as he hands you a pile of tiny spider carcasses.

column4: According to this map, "X" really does mark the spot! Seems unlikely it will be that simple...
column5: Though surprised to find an actual "X," you were not surprised by the attempted ambush. Albeit a failure, you have to admit the bandits' attempt was fairly clever.

column4: What appears at first to be an impressive scale model, soon proves to be something far more magical.
column5: Tiny people yell for help from the miniature village. You promise to return with help as soon as possible, but you're not entirely sure who could fix this...

column4: Ghostly players act out the untimely death of an ancient king before inviting the audience to join them on stage...
column5: You aid in acting out the final scene, revealing the brother to be the king's murderer. "Tell others what you have seen..." a ghost moans, "avenge our lord..."

column4: You are knocked over as a group of tiny constructs tear through the passage and into the darkness.
column5: Just as you sit up, you are knocked back over by an alchemist running after the constructs. "Wait!" he screams, "don't leave daddy!"

column4: You find a wizard kneeling at a glowing line on the floor. He looks back at you over his shoulder, eyes replaced by dancing energy.
column5: Using the found power to shoot magical bolts at you, the wizard taps into the node one too many times and explodes in a ball of fire.

column4: With a cackle and explosion of spores, an otherworldly creature fills the room with death and disease.
column5: You back away before the spores reach you. This place will be toxic for a while...

column4: The last thing you want to do is cast a spell here... unless you're feeling lucky, of course.
column5: You try casting a simple cantrip, but instead a fireball shoots from your fingertips, setting the room ablaze.

column4: The grandeur and opulence of the gallery far exceeds your expectations. Someone has worked tirelessly to acquire everything here.
column5: You almost don't want to disturb the magnificent gallery. Almost...
column6: The Exquisite Gallery is a place everyone should visit once in their lifetime.

column4: The vault is sealed by more than steel alone. It must be protecting something very valuable.
column5: You break the enchantment and the vault door swings open, revealing greater riches than you'd dreamed possible.
column6: A simple key will not unlock the Enchanted Vault.

column4: Before you can begin to sift through the piles of treasure, a stone hand reaches up through the gold and grabs your leg. These riches are not unguarded.
column5: You battle back against the animated stone, managing to break the enchantment. Now nothing stands between the treasure and you!
column6: Seems unlikely that a Filled Treasure Room would be completely unguarded...

column4: The room is filled with ghostly treasure on the verge of slipping away to another world. You don't have much time before it's all gone!
column5: Moving faster than ever before, you are able to recover a kingly amount of gold and riches!
column6: You have very little time before the Fading Riches are gone completely.

column4: Heavily-armed guards protect trophies that took their collector a lifetime to acquire.
column5: The battle is fierce, but ultimately you stand victorious. You look through the trophies and select the best of the lot.
column6: It will be difficult, but not impossible, to break into the Guarded Trophy Room.

column4: You could spend a lifetime in this library and barely make a dent in the first row of tomes.
column5: You grab a tome and get comfortable. You're going to be here a while...
column6: You've always wanted to see such a Vast Library.

column4: Stepping into the room you are struck by an overwhelming desire to lay down arms and spend your remaining days in the comforting embrace of a succubus singing just for you.
column5: It takes every ounce of strength to resist the siren song. With your last burst of willpower, you behead the creature, freeing yourself from its grasp.
column6: Will you be strong enough to resist the embodiment of pure Temptation?

column4: A large pile of riches sits on one side of a giant scale, the other side empty. An ethereal voice drifts through the room, "What is your worth? What is the sum of your deeds?"
column5: "Your worth is great and your deeds are just. The treasure is yours..."
column6: Your soul must be in balance before you approach The Scales.

column4: "Welcome, honored guests. I've been waiting for you. Take your place at my feet, swear your loyalty and I will give you eternal life and glory as my slaves."
column5: You wipe black ichor from your blade and look at the bodies of the slain queen and court. Slavery was not an option.
column6: You've been invited to visit the Court of the Dark Queen.

column4: "Here lies the fairest of the fair, taken long before her time. With the proper sacrifice, she will rise again," you hear someone say from within the empty room.
column5: Deciding the dead should stay dead, you turn to leave the room when suddenly confronted by a terrifying apparition. You know you made the right choice...
column6: You are long overdue to pay your respects at the Queen's Tomb.

column4: The abomination floats across the room, giving orders to its legion of thralls.
column5: Black ooze shoots from the creature's gaping maw as it screams and falls to the ground, dead.
column6: Stop A'dryx'l the Overseer from continuing its nightmarish reign.

column4: At first you're not sure if it's Murgal or an ice sculpture. Eventually, however, he takes a step, breaking the icicles that had formed.
column5: The ground is awash with red and blue. Might be festive if it weren't made up of frost goblin.
column6: Freeze the blue-skinned Murgal Mawcram in his tracks.

column4: A fiery breastplate floats through the air, powered by ancient elemental magics.
column5: The fires extinguished, General Ignazar's armor topples to the ground, still glowing a bright red.

column4: Before you stands the one intent on spreading darkness across the land, Regent Idris.
column5: Regent Idris falls, her hoard of thralls taking the opportunity to escape into the shadows.

column4: Still haunted by his former life, the Drowned King remains unable to find eternal rest.
column5: Death finally comes for the former king, giving him the peaceful rest he desires.
column6: Return The Drowned King to his eternal slumber.
